text:
We're using jakarta-tomcat in-house, and I've been finding that occasionally
when I make calls to "getAttribute" and "getId" on the HttpSession (as acquired
from the request object) that I get a null pointer exception because
"realSession" is null.

Some things that might contribute or cause this indirectly are:

For the duration of each request, I'm keeping a reference to the HttpSession
object around that can be accessed by any object, keyed by Thread.

The only servlet that has this problem is using introspection in its superclass
to invoke a method in its subclass.  The "invoke" method is a native method.


Here's the top of the stack from the null pointer:

org.apache.tomcat.facade.HttpSessionFacade.getAttribute(HttpSessionFacade.java:162)
